message.content: I want you to set up a few MCP's as docker containers and document the endpoints/usage. Let's make a new folder for mcp's maybe.. for the docker compose.  Okay, you start and i'll send you links to MCP servers to set up

content.text: I'll help you set up MCP servers as Docker containers. Let me create a folder structure and start with a docker-compose setup.

todos.content: Create MCP folder structure with docker-compose setup
Set up initial docker-compose.yml template
Create documentation for MCP endpoints and usage

content.content: Todos have been modified successfully. Ensure that you continue to use the todo list to track your progress. Please proceed with the current tasks if applicable

# MCP Servers Docker Setup

This directory contains Docker Compose configurations for running MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers.

## Quick Start

```bash
cd /Volumes/Stick/mcp-servers
docker-compose up -d
```

## Available MCP Servers

*Servers will be documented here as they are added*

## Usage

Each MCP server exposes endpoints that can be used with MCP-compatible clients. Server configurations and endpoints will be documented below as servers are added.

## Adding New Servers

To add a new MCP server:
1. Add service configuration to `docker-compose.yml`
2. Create any necessary configuration files in the `config/` directory
3. Update this README with endpoint documentation
4. Run `docker-compose up -d` to start the new service

## Network

All MCP servers run on the `mcp-network` bridge network for inter-service communication.

**[Puppeteer](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers-archived/tree/main/src/puppeteer)** - Browser automation and web scraping 36 - **[Redis](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers-archived/tree/main/src/redis)** - Interact with Redis key-value stores 37 - **[Sentry](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers-archived/tree/main/src/sentry)** - Retrieving and analyzing issues from Sentry.io 38 - **[Slack](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers-archived/tree/main/src/slack)** - **[21st.dev Magic](https://github.com/21st-dev/magic-mcp)** - Create crafted UI components inspired by the best 21st.dev design engineers. 48 - **[Adfin](https://github.com/Adfin-Engineering/mcp-server-adfin)** - The only platform you need to get paid - all payments in one place, invoicing and accounting reconciliations with [Adfin](https://www.adfin.com/). 49 - **[AgentQL](https://github.com/tinyfish-io/agentql-mcp)** - **[Aiven](https://github.com/Aiven-Open/mcp-aiven)** - Navigate your [Aiven projects](https://go.aiven.io/mcp-server) and interact with the PostgreSQL¬Æ, Apache Kafka¬Æ, ClickHouse¬Æ and OpenSearch¬Æ services 52 - **[Arize Phoenix](https://github.com/Arize-ai/phoenix/tree/main/js/packages/phoenix-mcp)** - Inspect traces, manage prompts, curate datasets, and run experiments using [Arize Phoenix](https://github.com/Arize-ai/phoenix), an open-source AI and LLM observability tool. 63 - **[Asgardeo](https://github.com/asgardeo/asgardeo-mcp-server)** - MCP server to interact with your [Asgardeo](https://wso2.com/asgardeo) organization through LLM tools. 64 - **[Astra DB](https://github.com/datastax/astra-db-mcp)** - Comprehensive tools for managing collections and documents in a [DataStax Astra DB](https://www.datastax.com/products/datastax-astra) NoSQL database with a full range of operations such as create, update, delete, find, and associated bulk actions. 65 - **[Atlan](https://github.com/atlanhq/agent-toolkit/tree/main/modelcontextprotocol)** - The Atlan Model Context Protocol server allows you to interact with the [Atlan](https://www.atlan.com/) services through multiple tools. 66 - **[Audiense Insights](https://github.com/AudienseCo/mcp-audiense-insights)** - Marketing insights and audience analysis from [Audiense](https://www.audiense.com/products/audiense-insights) reports, covering demographic, cultural, influencer, and content engagement analysis. 67 - **[AWS](https://github.com/awslabs/mcp)** - Specialized MCP servers that bring AWS best practices directly to your development workflow. 68 - **[Axiom](https://github.com/axiomhq/mcp-server-axiom)** - Query and analyze your Axiom logs, traces, and all other event data in natural language 69 - **[Azure](https://github.com/Azure/azure-mcp)** - The Azure MCP Server gives MCP Clients access to key Azure services and tools like Azure Storage, Cosmos DB, the Azure CLI, and more. 70 - content.text:
Based on my analysis of the SERVER_LIST.md file, I've found the file located at `/Volumes/Stick/mcp-servers/SERVER_LIST.md`. From the extensive list of MCP servers available, here are 10 particularly useful servers for development, data processing, web services, and other common tasks:

## 10 Most Useful MCP Servers

### 1. **[Filesystem](src/filesystem)** (Reference Server)
- **Purpose**: Secure file operations with configurable access controls
- **Use Case**: Essential for any file management tasks, reading/writing files, directory operations
- **Why Useful**: Core functionality needed by most development workflows

### 2. **[Fetch](src/fetch)** (Reference Server)
- **Purpose**: Web content fetching and conversion for efficient LLM usage
- **Use Case**: Web scraping, content extraction, data gathering from websites
- **Why Useful**: Fundamental for web data processing and research tasks

### 3. **[Git](src/git)** (Reference Server)
- **Purpose**: Tools to read, search, and manipulate Git repositories
- **Use Case**: Code management, repository operations, version control
- **Why Useful**: Essential for any software development workflow

### 4. **[PostgreSQL](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers-archived/tree/main/src/postgres)** (Archived Reference)
- **Purpose**: Read-only database access with schema inspection
- **Use Case**: Database queries, data analysis, schema exploration
- **Why Useful**: PostgreSQL is one of the most popular databases for enterprise applications

### 5. **[GitHub](https://github.com/github/github-mcp-server)** (Official Integration)
- **Purpose**: GitHub's official MCP Server for repository management
- **Use Case**: Issue tracking, pull requests, repository operations, CI/CD integration
- **Why Useful**: Central to most modern development workflows

### 6. **[Redis](https://github.com/redis/mcp-redis/)** (Official Integration)
- **Purpose**: Interface to manage and search data in Redis
- **Use Case**: Caching, session management, real-time data processing
- **Why Useful**: Widely used for performance optimization and real-time applications

### 7. **[MongoDB](https://github.com/mongodb-js/mongodb-mcp-server)** (Official Integration)
- **Purpose**: Support for both MongoDB Community Server and MongoDB Atlas
- **Use Case**: NoSQL database operations, document storage, analytics
- **Why Useful**: Popular choice for modern web applications and microservices

### 8. **[Docker](community servers mentioned in text)**
- **Purpose**: Container management and operations
- **Use Case**: Application deployment, environment management, DevOps workflows
- **Why Useful**: Standard for modern application deployment and development environments

### 9. **[AWS](https://github.com/awslabs/mcp)** (Official Integration)
- **Purpose**: Specialized MCP servers for AWS services following best practices
- **Use Case**: Cloud infrastructure management, serverless operations, cloud services
- **Why Useful**: AWS is the leading cloud platform for enterprise applications

### 10. **[Elasticsearch](https://github.com/elastic/mcp-server-elasticsearch)** (Official Integration)
- **Purpose**: Query data in Elasticsearch
- **Use Case**: Full-text search, log analysis, data exploration, business intelligence
- **Why Useful**: Powerful search and analytics engine used across many industries

## Additional Notable Mentions:

- **[E2B](https://github.com/e2b-dev/mcp-server)**: Run code in secure sandboxes - excellent for code execution and testing
- **[Firecrawl](https://github.com/mendableai/firecrawl-mcp-server)**: Advanced web scraping and data extraction
- **[Grafana](https://github.com/grafana/mcp-grafana)**: Monitoring and observability dashboards
- **[Linear](https://linear.app/docs/mcp)**: Modern project management and issue tracking

These servers cover the essential aspects of modern development workflows: file management, version control, databases (both SQL and NoSQL), web services, cloud infrastructure, search capabilities, and monitoring. They provide a solid foundation for building AI-powered development tools and automating common tasks.

The file contains hundreds of other specialized servers for specific use cases, but these 10 represent the most broadly applicable and useful servers for general development and data processing needs.

content.content:
Based on the web page content, here are the key details for the AppleScript MCP Server:

GitHub Repository:
- URL: https://github.com/Hassanali4/applescript-mcp
- Language: Python
- License: MIT License

Server Description:
"MCP server that execute applescript giving you full control of your Mac"

Key Features:
- Execute AppleScript commands through an MCP server
- Provides full control over macOS environments
- Cross-platform compatibility for sending HTTP requests

Installation:
- Requires macOS
- Requires Node.js
- Installation steps:
  1. Clone repository
  2. Install dependencies with `npm install`
  3. Start server with `npm start`

Usage Example:
```bash
curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/execute -d 'tell application "Finder" to make new folder at desktop with properties {name:"New Folder"}'
```

The server allows remote execution of AppleScript commands via HTTP requests, enabling task automation and system control on macOS.

Based on the search results, I found comprehensive information about MCP (Model Context Protocol) Docker server configuration, particularly for GitHub integration. Here are the key findings:

## GitHub MCP Server Docker Configuration

GitHub's official MCP Server is available as a Docker container and can be configured in several ways:

### Docker Installation and Setup

To run the server in a container, you will need to have Docker installed. Once Docker is installed, you will also need to ensure Docker is running.

### Basic Docker Command

docker run -i --rm \ -e GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN=<your-token> \ -e GITHUB_TOOLSETS="repos,issues,pull_requests,code_security,experiments" \ ghcr.io/github/github-mcp-server

### VS Code Configuration

For VS Code integration, you can configure the MCP server using a `.vscode/mcp.json` file:

{ "mcp": { "inputs": [ { "type": "promptString", "id": "github_token", "description": "GitHub Personal Access Token", "password": true } ], "servers": { "github": { "command": "docker", "args": [ "run", "-i", "--rm", "-e", "GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN", "ghcr.io/github/github-mcp-server" ], "env": { "GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN": "${input:github_token}" } } } } }

### Claude Desktop Configuration

{ "mcpServers": { "github": { "command": "docker", "args": [ "run", "-i", "--rm", "-e", "GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN", "ghcr.io/github/github-mcp-server" ], "env": { "GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN": "<YOUR_TOKEN>" } } } }

### Additional Docker MCP Servers

There are also other Docker-related MCP servers available:

1. **Docker Management MCP Server**: MCP server for Docker. An MCP server for managing Docker with natural language!

2. **Docker Integration**: Docker - Integrate with Docker to manage containers, images, volumes, and networks.

### Key Features

The GitHub MCP Server supports enabling or disabling specific groups of functionalities via the --toolsets flag. This allows you to control which GitHub API capabilities are available to your AI tools. Enabling only the toolsets that you need can help the LLM with tool choice and reduce the context size.

### Prerequisites

The primary prerequisite is Docker, which is required to run the server in a container. You'll also need a GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT) to authenticate with GitHub's APIs.

The GitHub MCP Server provides a standardized way to integrate AI tools with GitHub's ecosystem through Docker containers, making it easy to deploy and configure across different environments.

Based on the search results, I can provide you with comprehensive information about configuring MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers for Git and GitHub with Docker:

## GitHub MCP Server Configuration

GitHub's official MCP Server provides seamless integration with GitHub APIs. Here are the key Docker configuration options:

### Basic Docker Configuration
To run the server in a container, you will need to have Docker installed. Once Docker is installed, you will also need to ensure Docker is running.

Basic Docker command:
```bash
docker run -i --rm \
  -e GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN=<your-token> \
  -e GITHUB_TOOLSETS="repos,issues,pull_requests,code_security,experiments" \
  ghcr.io/github/github-mcp-server
```

### VS Code Configuration
For VS Code integration, you can add this configuration to your settings JSON:

```json
{
  "mcp": {
    "inputs": [
      {
        "type": "promptString",
        "id": "github_token",
        "description": "GitHub Personal Access Token",
        "password": true
      }
    ],
    "servers": {
      "github": {
        "command": "docker",
        "args": [
          "run", "-i", "--rm", "-e", "GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN",
          "ghcr.io/github/github-mcp-server"
        ],
        "env": {
          "GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN": "<YOUR_TOKEN>"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

### Claude Desktop Configuration
To use the GitHub MCP Server with Claude Desktop, add the following configuration:

```json
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "github": {
      "command": "docker",
      "args": [
        "run", "-i", "--rm", "-e", "GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN",
        "ghcr.io/github/github-mcp-server"
      ],
      "env": {
        "GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN": "<YOUR_TOKEN>"
      }
    }
  }
}
```

## Git MCP Server

The MCP servers include Git tools to read, search, and manipulate Git repositories, and there are Docker images available for Git operations as well.

## Docker MCP Server Options

There are several specialized Docker MCP servers available:

1. **Official Docker Hub Images**: Docker Hub hosts official MCP server images including mcp/github and mcp/git

2. **Third-party Docker MCP Servers**: An MCP server for managing Docker with natural language allows you to control Docker containers through AI interactions.

## Dynamic Toolsets Feature

Instead of starting with all tools enabled, you can turn on dynamic toolset discovery. Dynamic toolsets allow the MCP host to list and enable toolsets in response to a user prompt. This should help to avoid situations where the model gets confused by the sheer number of tools available.

For dynamic toolsets with Docker:
```bash
docker run -i --rm \
  -e GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN=<your-token> \
  -e GITHUB_DYNAMIC_TOOLSETS=1 \
  ghcr.io/github/github-mcp-server
```

## Prerequisites

The primary prerequisite is Docker, which is required to run the server in a container. You'll also need a GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT) to authenticate with GitHub's APIs.

These configurations enable you to integrate AI tools with GitHub repositories, manage Docker containers, and perform Git operations through the Model Context Protocol framework.

Based on the provided content, this is a GitHub repository for Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. The README highlights several key points:

1. Purpose: The repository contains "reference implementations" for MCP servers that enable "Large Language Models (LLMs) to get secure, controlled access to tools and data sources."

2. Reference Servers: The repository includes servers for various functionalities like:
- Filesystem: "Secure file operations with configurable access controls"
- Git: "Tools to read, search, and manipulate Git repositories"
- Time: "Time and timezone conversion capabilities"

3. Implementation: Servers are built using either the "Typescript MCP SDK" or "Python MCP SDK"

4. Unique Note: The README mentions that "Lists in this README are maintained in alphabetical order to minimize merge conflicts"

The repository appears to be a comprehensive collection of modular, extensible server implementations designed to enhance AI interactions with different systems and data sources.

Based on the README, here are the key Docker configuration details for the GitHub MCP Server:

Docker Run Configuration:
```
docker run -i --rm \
 -e GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN=<your-token> \
 ghcr.io/github/github-mcp-server
```

Key Environment Variables:
- `GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN`: Required GitHub personal access token
- Optional variables:
  - `GITHUB_TOOLSETS`: Specify which GitHub API toolsets to enable
  - `GITHUB_DYNAMIC_TOOLSETS`: Enable dynamic toolset discovery
  - `GITHUB_HOST`: Set for GitHub Enterprise Server or Enterprise Cloud

Prerequisites:
1. Docker must be installed and running
2. Create a GitHub Personal Access Token with appropriate permissions

Notable Configuration Options:
- Can limit toolsets to specific areas like "repos", "issues", "pull_requests"
- Supports GitHub Enterprise Server and GitHub Enterprise Cloud
- Configurable through Docker environment variables or command-line flags

content.text:
Based on my research, here's a comprehensive overview of the MCP servers you requested:

## Reference Servers

### 1. Filesystem MCP Server
- **GitHub Repository**: https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers/tree/main/src/filesystem
- **Docker Image**: `mcp/filesystem` (Docker Hub)
- **Functionality**: Secure file operations with configurable access controls
- **Docker Configuration**:
  ```bash
  docker run -i --rm \
    --mount type=bind,src=/path/to/allowed/dir,dst=/projects/allowed/dir \
    mcp/filesystem /projects
  ```
- **Ports**: No specific ports (uses stdio)
- **Environment Variables**: None specified
- **Setup**: Requires mount bindings for directory access

### 2. Git MCP Server
- **GitHub Repository**: https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/servers/tree/main/src/git
- **Docker Image**: `mcp/git` (Docker Hub)
- **Functionality**: Tools to read, search, and manipulate Git repositories
- **Docker Configuration**: Standard MCP stdio configuration
- **Ports**: No specific ports
- **Environment Variables**: None specified
- **Setup**: Basic installation through npm or Docker

### 3. GitHub MCP Server (Docker-related)
- **GitHub Repository**: https://github.com/github/github-mcp-server
- **Docker Image**: `ghcr.io/github/github-mcp-server`
- **Functionality**: Integration with GitHub APIs for repositories, issues, pull requests
- **Docker Configuration**:
  ```bash
  docker run -i --rm \
    -e GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN=<your-token> \
    -e GITHUB_TOOLSETS="repos,issues,pull_requests,code_security,experiments" \
    ghcr.io/github/github-mcp-server
  ```
- **Ports**: No specific ports (uses stdio)
- **Environment Variables**:
  - `GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN` (required)
  - `GITHUB_TOOLSETS` (optional)
  - `GITHUB_DYNAMIC_TOOLSETS` (optional)
  - `GITHUB_HOST` (for Enterprise)

## Community Servers

### 4. Super Shell MCP Server
- **GitHub Repository**: https://github.com/cfdude/super-shell-mcp
- **Docker Image**: Not available
- **Functionality**: Execute shell commands across Windows, macOS, and Linux with security controls
- **Default Ports**: No specific ports
- **Environment Variables**: Not specified
- **Setup**: npm install or manual git clone
- **Key Features**: Command whitelisting, security levels, non-blocking approval workflow

### 5. MCP Server for macOS Use
- **GitHub Repository**: https://github.com/nunyabiznessyoubeezy/mcp-server-macos-use
- **Docker Image**: Not available
- **Functionality**: AI agent for controlling macOS with OS-level tools
- **Language**: Swift
- **Default Ports**: No specific ports
- **Environment Variables**: Not specified
- **Setup**: Download release and execute, launch via Terminal with `mcp-server`

### 6. Scheduler MCP Server
- **GitHub Repository**: https://github.com/PhialsBasement/scheduler-mcp
- **Docker Image**: Not specified
- **Functionality**: Task automation server for scheduling shell commands, API calls, AI tasks, and desktop notifications using cron expressions
- **Language**: Python
- **Requirements**: Python 3.10+
- **Default Ports**: No specific ports
- **Environment Variables**: Configurable via environment variables, CLI args, or JSON config
- **Setup**: Cross-platform (Windows, macOS, Linux)

### 7. AppleScript MCP Server
- **GitHub Repository**: https://github.com/Hassanali4/applescript-mcp
- **Docker Image**: Not available
- **Functionality**: Execute AppleScript commands for full macOS control
- **Language**: Python
- **Default Ports**: 3000 (HTTP server)
- **Environment Variables**: Not specified
- **Setup**: 
  - Requires macOS and Node.js
  - Clone repo, run `npm install`, then `npm start`
- **Usage**: HTTP POST to `http://localhost:3000/execute`

## Summary

**Reference servers** (filesystem, git, GitHub) have official Docker images and follow standardized MCP patterns using stdio communication. They're well-documented and production-ready.

**Community servers** vary significantly in their Docker support - most don't provide Docker images and require manual installation. They tend to be more specialized for specific platforms (especially macOS) and use different communication methods (some use HTTP instead of stdio).

The reference servers are your best bet for Docker-based deployments, while community servers offer specialized functionality but may require more custom setup work.

input.new_string:
version: '3.8'

services:
  # Reference MCP Servers (Official Docker Images)
  
  mcp-filesystem:
    image: mcp/filesystem
    container_name: mcp-filesystem
    stdin_open: true
    tty: true
    volumes:
      - ./data:/projects/data
      - ./config:/projects/config
    networks:
      - mcp-network
    restart: unless-stopped
    command: ["/projects"]

  mcp-git:
    image: mcp/git
    container_name: mcp-git
    stdin_open: true
    tty: true
    volumes:
      - ./repos:/repos
    networks:
      - mcp-network
    restart: unless-stopped

  mcp-github:
    image: ghcr.io/github/github-mcp-server
    container_name: mcp-github
    stdin_open: true
    tty: true
    environment:
      - GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN=${GITHUB_TOKEN}
      - GITHUB_TOOLSETS=repos,issues,pull_requests,code_security
    networks:
      - mcp-network
    restart: unless-stopped

  # Community MCP Servers (Custom Builds Required)
  
  # Note: The following servers don't have official Docker images
  # They require manual setup or custom Docker builds:
  
  # mcp-super-shell:
  #   # Custom build required from: https://github.com/cfdude/super-shell-mcp
  #   build:
  #     context: ./builds/super-shell-mcp
  #     dockerfile: Dockerfile
  #   container_name: mcp-super-shell
  #   stdin_open: true
  #   tty: true
  #   networks:
  #     - mcp-network
  #   restart: unless-stopped

  # mcp-macos-use:
  #   # macOS-specific, requires native setup
  #   # From: https://github.com/nunyabiznessyoubeezy/mcp-server-macos-use
  #   # Cannot run in Docker due to macOS system dependencies

  # mcp-scheduler:
  #   # Custom build required from: https://github.com/PhialsBasement/scheduler-mcp
  #   build:
  #     context: ./builds/scheduler-mcp
  #     dockerfile: Dockerfile
  #   container_name: mcp-scheduler
  #   stdin_open: true
  #   tty: true
  #   networks:
  #     - mcp-network
  #   restart: unless-stopped

  mcp-applescript:
    # Custom build for AppleScript server (HTTP-based)
    build:
      context: ./builds/applescript-mcp
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: mcp-applescript
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    networks:
      - mcp-network
    restart: unless-stopped
    # Note: Requires macOS Docker environment or custom setup

networks:
  mcp-network:
    driver: bridge

volumes:
  mcp-data:
    driver: local

## Usage

input.new_string:
# MCP Servers Docker Setup

This directory contains Docker Compose configurations for running MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers.

## Quick Start

```bash
cd /Volumes/Stick/mcp-servers
cp .env.example .env
# Edit .env with your credentials
docker-compose up -d
```

## Available MCP Servers

### Reference Servers (Official Docker Images)

#### 1. **Filesystem MCP Server** (`mcp-filesystem`)
- **Purpose**: Secure file operations with configurable access controls
- **Endpoints**: Stdio-based MCP protocol
- **Volumes**: 
  - `./data` ‚Üí `/projects/data` (file operations)
  - `./config` ‚Üí `/projects/config` (configuration)
- **Usage**: Secure file reading, writing, and directory operations

#### 2. **Git MCP Server** (`mcp-git`)
- **Purpose**: Tools to read, search, and manipulate Git repositories
- **Endpoints**: Stdio-based MCP protocol
- **Volumes**: `./repos` ‚Üí `/repos` (Git repositories)
- **Usage**: Repository management, commit history, branch operations

#### 3. **GitHub MCP Server** (`mcp-github`)
- **Purpose**: Official GitHub integration for repositories, issues, PRs
- **Endpoints**: Stdio-based MCP protocol
- **Environment**: Requires `GITHUB_TOKEN` in `.env`
- **Features**: repos, issues, pull_requests, code_security toolsets
- **Usage**: GitHub API operations, repository management

### Community Servers (Custom Setup Required)

#### 4. **Super Shell MCP** (Commented - Manual Setup)
- **Repository**: https://github.com/cfdude/super-shell-mcp
- **Purpose**: Execute shell commands with security controls
- **Setup**: Requires custom Docker build or native installation
- **Platform**: Cross-platform (Windows, macOS, Linux)

#### 5. **macOS Use MCP** (Commented - Native Only)
- **Repository**: https://github.com/nunyabiznessyoubeezy/mcp-server-macos-use
- **Purpose**: AI agent for controlling macOS with OS-level tools
- **Setup**: Native macOS setup only (Swift binary)
- **Platform**: macOS only

#### 6. **Scheduler MCP** (Commented - Manual Setup)
- **Repository**: https://github.com/PhialsBasement/scheduler-mcp
- **Purpose**: Task automation with cron expressions
- **Setup**: Requires custom Docker build or Python installation
- **Platform**: Cross-platform

#### 7. **AppleScript MCP** (Configured - HTTP)
- **Repository**: https://github.com/Hassanali4/applescript-mcp
- **Purpose**: Execute AppleScript commands for macOS control
- **Port**: 3000 (HTTP server)
- **Endpoint**: `POST http://localhost:3000/execute`
- **Setup**: Requires custom Docker build with macOS support

## Environment Variables

Create `.env` file from `.env.example`:

```bash
# Required for GitHub MCP Server
GITHUB_TOKEN=your_github_personal_access_token_here
```

## Directory Structure

```
mcp-servers/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ docker-compose.yml    # Docker services configuration
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md            # This documentation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .env.example         # Environment variables template
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .env                 # Your environment variables (create this)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ config/              # Configuration files
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ data/                # Filesystem MCP data directory
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ repos/               # Git repositories for Git MCP
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ builds/              # Custom Docker builds (for community servers)
```

## Usage Examples

### Starting Services
```bash
# Start all available services
docker-compose up -d

# Start specific service
docker-compose up -d mcp-filesystem

# View logs
docker-compose logs -f mcp-github
```

### Connecting to MCP Servers

Most servers use stdio-based MCP protocol. Connect using MCP-compatible clients:

```bash
# Example: Connect to filesystem server
docker exec -it mcp-filesystem /bin/sh
```

### AppleScript Server (HTTP)
```bash
# Execute AppleScript via HTTP
curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/execute \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"script": "tell application \"Finder\" to get name of startup disk"}'
```

## Network

All MCP servers run on the `mcp-network` bridge network for inter-service communication.

## Notes

- **Reference servers** have official Docker images and are production-ready
- **Community servers** require manual setup or custom Docker builds
- macOS-specific servers may not work properly in Docker containers
- Some servers use HTTP instead of the standard stdio MCP protocol
